data.event: Established in 1817, residents named the town after Andrew Jackson, a hero of the War of 1812, and an eventual president of the United States.

event.title: named the town after Andrew Jackson, a hero of the War of 1812

data.event: Established in 1817, residents named the town after Andrew Jackson, a hero of the War of 1812, and an eventual president of the United States.

event.title: grew slowly, having only 297 inhabitants in 1840

data.event: The community grew slowly, having only 297 inhabitants in 1840.
In 1846, Jackson contained four churches, approximately seven stores, and a single newspaper office.

event.title: the next forty years the town grew

data.event: Over the next forty years the town grew quickly, attaining a population of 3,021 people in 1880.
By 1880 two railroad lines passed through the community, helping to spur economic and population growth.

event.title: 1886 two newspaper offices, eight churches, and two banks existed

data.event: In 1886 two newspaper offices, eight churches, and two banks existed in Jackson.
